movie_title: Assoc Prof Elizabeth Tham and Dr Chong Kok Wee on national study on childhood food allergies
introduction: 2,000 children will participate in a national food allergy study as hospitals in Singapore see a spi

vocabulary.definition: a damaging immune response by the body to a substance, especially a particular food, pollen, fur, or dust, to which it has become hypersensitive.
vocabulary.example: Her allergy to peanuts makes it difficult for her to enjoy certain foods.

vocabulary.definition: the fact or condition of being prevalent; commonness.
vocabulary.example: The prevalence of allergies among children is increasing worldwide.

vocabulary.definition: a severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction.
vocabulary.example: The child experienced anaphylaxis after eating a peanut.

vocabulary.definition: persisting for a long time or constantly recurring.
vocabulary.example: His chronic asthma requires him to use an inhaler daily.

vocabulary.definition: the way in which two or more things have an effect on each other.
vocabulary.example: The interplay between genetics and the environment influences our health.

vocabulary.definition: including all the services or items normally expected or required.
vocabulary.example: The school promotes an inclusive environment for students of all abilities.
